summary: This document appears to be a trial preparation memo for a witness (likely a pilot or staff member) who was shown various exhibits (GX-113, GX-114, GX-112, GX-327, GX-110, GX-12) and confirmed recognizing them. The witness provided clarifying statements about Jeffrey Epstein's travel patterns to the US Virgin Islands starting around 1998 and the communication methods used by pilots.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'JE' in the document; witness statements indicate he started traveling to USVI most weekends around 1998.

events.title: Epstein begins frequent USVI travel
events.description: Around 1998, Jeffrey Epstein started going to the US Virgin Islands most weekends according to witness recollection.

events.title: Trial testimony preparation
events.description: A witness was prepared for trial testimony by being shown various exhibits (GX-113, GX-114, GX-112, GX-327, GX-110, GX-12) and confirming recognition of them.

keyFacts: A witness was prepared for trial testimony on November 12, 2021, and shown multiple exhibits (GX-113, GX-114, GX-112, GX-327, GX-110, GX-12).
The witness confirmed recognizing the exhibits, which appear to include references to 'VR' (possibly Virginia Roberts) and 'JE' (Jeffrey Epstein).
The witness stated that around 1998, Jeffrey Epstein began traveling to the US Virgin Islands most weekends.
The witness recalled that pilots initially used beepers to notify of flights, then later used cellphones.
